attributes.action: Prevent Southend Hospital from culling pigeons as a form of 'pest control'
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015, 790 pigeons were killed by breaking their necks.

https://www.echo-news.co.uk/news/13438998.Pest_control_company_killed_feral_birds_by_breaking_necks/

Many pigeons are still trapped in metal cages on the roof of the hospital and dying right now, waiting for pest control contractors to come and break their neck.

https://www.southendstandard.co.uk/news/17346684.hospital-slammed-for-using-cages-to-trap-and-kill-troublesome-pigeons/
attributes.background:
The Southend University Hospital (SSO 0RY) have been killing hundreds of pigeons for years in a very cruel way by trapping them in cages on the roof and then snapping their necks.

They have have stated this is done for 'health & safety' without providing evidence of preventative measures taken.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because this would be the responsibility of Southend Hospital and not the UK Government and Parliament.
